exceptions.tactic: apply well_founded_lt_compat with (f := fun x => fst x + snd x).
exceptions.exn: The term "fun x : Z * Z => fst x + snd x" has type "Z * Z -> Z" while it is expected to have type "Z * Z -> nat" (cannot unify "Z" and "nat").

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
well_founded R_noet

Premises:
well_founded : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> Prop) -> Prop
R_noet = fun x y : nat * nat => (fst x + snd x < fst y + snd y)%nat : nat * nat -> nat * nat -> Prop
Acc_intro_generator : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), nat -> well_founded R -> well_founded R
lt_wf = well_founded_ltof nat (fun m : nat => m) : well_founded lt
well_founded_gtof : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat), well_founded (gtof A f)
well_founded_ltof : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat), well_founded (ltof A f)
well_founded_inv_rel_inv_lt_rel : forall (A : Set) (F : A -> nat -> Prop), well_founded (inv_lt_rel A F)
N.gt_wf : forall z : N, well_founded (fun n m : N => (m < n <= z)%N)
Nat.gt_wf : forall z : nat, well_founded (fun n m : nat => (m < n <= z)%nat)
Z.lt_wf : forall z : Z, well_founded (fun n m : Z => z <= n < m)
N.lt_wf : forall z : N, well_founded (fun n m : N => (z <= n < m)%N)
Nat.lt_wf : forall z : nat, well_founded (fun n m : nat => (z <= n < m)%nat)
Z.gt_wf : forall z : Z, well_founded (fun n m : Z => m < n <= z)
well_founded_lt_compat : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (R : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> (f x < f y)%nat) -> well_founded R
well_founded_inv_lt_rel_compat : forall (A : Set) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (F : A -> nat -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> inv_lt_rel A F x y) -> well_founded R
well_founded_induction : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall P : A -> Set, (forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall a : A, P a
well_founded_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall P : A -> Prop, (forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall a : A, P a
Fix : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall P : A -> Type, (forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : A, P x
well_founded_induction_type : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall P : A -> Type, (forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall a : A, P a
well_founded_induction_type_2 : forall (A B : Type) (R : A * B -> A * B -> Prop) (P : A -> B -> Type), well_founded R -> (forall (x : A) (x' : B), (forall (y : A) (y' : B), R (y, y') (x, x') -> P y y') -> P x x') -> forall (a : A) (b : B), P a b
Nat.lt_wf_0 = let H : SetoidTactics.default_relation lt (fun n m : nat => (0 <= n < m)%nat) := fun x y : nat => conj (fun H : (x < y)%nat => conj (Nat.le_0_l x) H) (fun H0 : (0 <= x < y)%nat => match H0 with | conj _ H => H end) in (fun Heq : RelationClasses.relation_equivalence lt (fun n m : nat => (0 <= n < m)%nat) => Morphisms.subrelation_proper Morphisms_Prop.well_founded_morphism tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl RelationClasses.relation_equivalence) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation) lt (fun n m : nat => (0 <= n < m)%nat) Heq (Nat.lt_wf 0)) H : well_founded lt
N.lt_wf_0 = let H : SetoidTactics.default_relation N.lt (fun n m : N => (0 <= n < m)%N) := fun x y : N => conj (fun H : (x < y)%N => conj (N.le_0_l x) H) (fun H0 : (0 <= x < y)%N => match H0 with | conj _ H => H end) in (fun Heq : RelationClasses.relation_equivalence N.lt (fun n m : N => (0 <= n < m)%N) => Morphisms.subrelation_proper Morphisms_Prop.well_founded_morphism tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl RelationClasses.relation_equivalence) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation) N.lt (fun n m : N => (0 <= n < m)%N) Heq (N.lt_wf 0)) H : well_founded N.lt
Fix_F_inv : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall (P : A -> Type) (F : forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x), (forall (x : A) (f g : forall y : A, R y x -> P y), (forall (y : A) (p : R y x), f y p = g y p) -> F x f = F x g) -> forall (x : A) (r s : Acc R x), Fix_F P F r = Fix_F P F s
Fix_eq : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (Rwf : well_founded R) (P : A -> Type) (F : forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x), (forall (x : A) (f g : forall y : A, R y x -> P y), (forall (y : A) (p : R y x), f y p = g y p) -> F x f = F x g) -> forall x : A, Fix Rwf P F x = F x (fun (y : A) (_ : R y x) => Fix Rwf P F y)
N.nle_gt : forall n m : N, ~ (n <= m)%N < -> (m < n)%N
VectorDef.cons : forall A : Type, A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n)
QArith_base.Qden = fun q : QArith_base.Q => let (_, Qden) := q in Qden : QArith_base.Q -> positive
ssrbool.pair_andP : forall P Q : Prop, P /\ Q < -> P * Q
List.list_prod : forall A B : Type, list A -> list B -> list (A * B)
ZMicromega.eval_nformula = RingMicromega.eval_nformula 0 Z.add Z.mul eq Z.le Z.lt (fun x : Z => x) : RingMicromega.PolEnv Z -> RingMicromega.NFormula Z -> Prop
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope

```coq
apply well_founded_lt_compat with (f := fun x => fst x + snd x).
intros [x1 y1] [x2 y2] H.
simpl in *.
assumption.
Qed.
